messages.title: We called to see you today
Labour has let you down
messages.content: Labour's years of seeing the gap between rich and poor widen - something the Labour Party and the ashamed of what the Conservatives dismiss tax breaks for the rich. Only Lib Dem promises that work for ordinary working people to hear.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £10,000 tax free no income tax if you earn less than £10,000, £700 tax cut for workers, £100 tax cut for pensioners. Closing super-rich loopholes taxing the polluters.

mentions.candidate: Gareth Epps has been working with the local people and Gareth Epps with Rebecca Rye.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Votes cast in the 2007 local election including that Liberal Democrats are the main challengers to Conservatives. Only Lib Dem Gareth Epps can beat the Conservative MP in the general election. Only Rebecca Rye can stop Labour staying in.

issues.economy: Labour's years of seeing the gap between rich and poor widen - something the Labour Party and the ashamed of what the Conservatives dismiss tax breaks for the rich. Only Lib Dem promises that work for ordinary working people to hear.

leaflet.personalStatement: Gareth Epps ...working for a better Reading East

politicalExperience.achievements: Gareth Epps campaigned to keep Post Offices across Reading East open whilst Labour allowed them to be closed.

images.caption: Gareth Epps and Rebecca Rye working together.
